project.description: Test to see if we can use scontrol to add our build info to slurm comment. Note that this will overwrite any existing comment. That makes sense if we only run one job per agent invocation. However, since we have a delay before tearing down the agent, other Jenkins jobs may land on it. I was hoping to use this to to aid in sacct mappiung of resource usage to Jenkins job.

hudson.tasks.Shell.command:
hostname scontrol update jobid=$SLURM_JOB_ID comment=$BUILD_TAG # Dang. This doesn't work, probably because we tell the agent slurm java agent jobs to erase # their SLURM environment to avoid problems with using slurm from within an agent.
# This wasn't a completely feasable idea to being with since multiple Jenkins jobs # could serially run on the same Jenkins agent. However, it would be nice to # record this data somehow.
